subanswer.text: Once per month means once in every four weeks (since there are typically about 4 weeks in a month). Therefore, Buford pays the electric bill one time every month or roughly once every three weeks assuming all months follow this average length. However it’s important to note that not all months exactly contain 4 weeks; hence if precise frequency isn’t asked for we can approximate as 'once every month.' But strictly speaking based off our initial calculation – since we equated ‘month’ directly to “four weeks”—the exact duration would fall around twice within any particular set of six consecutive calendar months due to longer than four week lengths occurring occasionally during those periods.

1.subquestion: Including both utility payments, what sum do checks constitute per annum if every single charge adheres strictly to said frequency without deviation or lapse?

subanswer.text: If Buford issues exactly one check for his electricity, one for gas, and two for charitable contributions biweekly, over the course of a year they would be sent out thus: Electrical bill – 12 times, Gas Bill – 12 times, Charitable Donations – 2 * 26 weeks = 52 times. Total Check Frequency Per Year equals (1+1+52)*(number_of_months) = 57*12 months = 684 instances. ost_step.1: We know that every year consists of 12 months or 'annual temporal divisions'.
ost_step.2: From condition 1, for each month, there’s always at least one check from paying the electricity bills which means over a whole year – once per month * twelve months equals eleven checks used on electricity.
ost_step.3: According to condition 2, similarly, fifteen other identical checks go toward paying off the gas bill across all these twelve months because it also happens once a month.
ost_step.4: In accordance with condition 3, twenty-four additional transactions occur twice daily as part of regular contributions made to their place of worship since two times sixteen equal thirty-two instances happen throughout those same dozen periods.

1.subquestion: How often does Buford pay the electric bill using a check?

subanswer.text: Buford pays the electric bill once per month, meaning he writes one check for the electric bill every month. There are 12 months in a year, so he will write 12 checks for the electric bill annually. The answer is 12.

ost_step.1: Similarly, since he also needs to pay his gas bill each month (assuming it happens at least as often), that means another set of 12 checks over the course of the year. That’s again two separate sets of 12 annual checks – electrical plus gas bills equals 24 checks.

direct_answer.text:
Let's break this down into its components based on frequency throughout the year. Here's what we know:
1. Electric Bill Check: once/month --> 12 times/year
2. Gas Bill Check: unspecified but assumed equal or greater than once/month like electricity --> Let us assume minimum twice/month which equates to 2*12=24 times/year; however considering statement clarifies both occur equally frequent let them same so no need to double counting -> still only one such instance adding up to 12 times/year
3. Church Contributions Check: twice/month => 2*(12 months) =  24 times/year
4. Pest & Lawn Service Payments : Quarterly implies four times within twelve months ~~~>> hence ,    4 instances * 1 time each =       4 checks / year    Adding all these together, we get Total Annual Check Frequency Equals [Electric+Gas] + Church contributions +Pest&Lawn services . Which translates numerically to-->       [(1)*(12)+[(1)]+(24+4)= 12+12+24+
